message_1: Evaluate the limit of the function f(x) = (x^2 - 4x - 5) / (x - 5) as x approaches 5.
message_2:
To evaluate the limit of the function f(x) = (x^2 - 4x - 5) / (x - 5) as x approaches 5, we can first try to simplify the function by factoring the numerator:

x^2 - 4x - 5 = (x - 5)(x + 1)

Now, the function can be written as:

f(x) = ((x - 5)(x + 1)) / (x - 5)

We can cancel out the (x - 5) terms:

f(x) = x + 1

Now, we can find the limit as x approaches 5:

lim (x -> 5) (x + 1) = 5 + 1 = 6

So, the limit of the function f(x) = (x^2 - 4x - 5) / (x - 5) as x approaches 5 is 6.
